info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 6:12PM CDT until July 10 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following county, Winnebago.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 609 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. A Flash Flood Warning also continues for much of central Winnebago County, including the northern Rockford metro. Additional thunderstorms with heavy rain are expected this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockford, Loves Park, Machesney Park, Roscoe, South Beloit, Rockton, Pecatonica, Lake Summerset, Durand, Harrison and Shirland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING
